page.title: 19Ghost Stories of Rosehill.
page.content: These tales are part of the "folklore" that has built up around the old cinema at Rosehill. When the cinema was being constructed in the 1930's one of the builders was seen to fall from the scaffolding. He is supposed to reappear and haunt the building from time to time. When cinema audiences were entertained by the Organist, Rosehill cinema audiences did not miss out.The second tale concerns an organist who collapsed and died while playing in front of an audience.He also is supposed to walk around what is now a Bingo Hall and frighten the customers. He makes his presence felt by opening and shutting doors, playing at an organ which no longer exists and causing cold air to rush past people when no doors or windows are open. A strange tale indeed!
